Course Format:
This online course is conducted through asynchronous (“on-demand”) learning methods:
- The course will be implemented through Luna. All materials, assessments, and communications will be provided there. Check the “URL links” field below for our course Luna homepage.
- The course will be delivered online on-demand throughout the semester, unless the KGU COVID restrictions become Level 2
or lower.
- Materials will be posted on Tuesday for each weekly session. The first session is Tuesday, September 21, so be sure to visit the course Luna site then.
- Most weekly sessions will include an academic English reading (usually 8 - 15 pages, but they could be longer) and a narrated PowerPoint lecture video.
- Three sessions will be used to complete Luna tests, each covering 3 weeks of the course.
- The final session will be used to complete a written assignment.

NOTE: This online course has a heavy academic English reading demand. Students should have sufficient English ability to understand long academic English texts and the motivation to engage with course content in English.

[Information for students with university permission to take classes online]:
Such students are expected to participate in this online on-demand course as usual. If the KGU COVID restrictions are
lowered and the course is moved to face-to-face, then data recorded from face-to-face lectures will be broadcast on-demand. Links to the recorded lessons will be provided on LUNA. All course assessments will remain online.
